1.q_string:
How many moles of electrons are needed for the reduction of each mole of Chromium pentaoxide in the following reaction?
CrO5 + H2SO4 → Cr2(SO4)3 + H2O + O2
How many coulombs of electricity is required for the complete reduction of MnO<sub>4</sub><sup>-</sup> in 500 ml of 0.5 M solution to Mn<sup>2+ </sup>ions?
If four moles of electrons are transferred from anode to cathode in an experiment on electrolysis of water, then the total volume of the two gases produced at STP will be
In which of the following reactions does HNO<sub>3</sub> not behave as an oxidising agent?

q_option: The acidity of hydroxyl amine is 1.
6 milliequivalent of Fe<sub>2</sub>(SO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3 </sub>is contained in 3 millimoles of ferric sulphate.
1.q_string:
Directions: The following question has four choices, out of which only one is correct.
Hydroxyl amine reduces iron(III) according to the following equation.
NH2OH + Fe2(SO4)3 → N2 + H2O + FeSO4 + H2SO4
Which of the following statements is/are correct?

q_option: equal with both the oxidising agents
Cannot be determined because of insufficient data
1.q_string: Equal volumes of 1M KMnO<sub>4</sub> and K<sub>2</sub>Cr<sub>2</sub>O<sub>7</sub> are used to oxidise Fe(II) solution in acidic medium. The amount of Fe(II) oxidised will be

q_option: The n-factor ratio of Mn<sup>+2</sup> to BrO<sub>3</sub><sup>-1</sup> is 1 : 1.
This is an example of decomposition reaction.
The equivalent weight of Br<sub>2</sub> is M<sub>2</sub>/5.
The equivalent weight of MnO<sub>4 </sub><sup>-1</sup> is M<sub>1</sub>/10.
1.q_string:

Which of the following ores of iron has fractional oxidation state of iron metal?
In the reaction HAsO2 + Sn2+ →As + Sn4+ + H2O, the oxidising agent is

q_option: Velocity of \(K^{+}\) is greater than that of \(N O_{3}\)
Velocity of both \(K^{+}\) and \(N O_{3}^{-}\) are nearly same

One mole of \(\mathrm{N}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{4}\) loses 10 mole electrons to form a new compound Y. Assuming that all the \(\mathrm{N}_{2}\) appears in new compound, what is the oxidation state of Nitrogen in Y? (There is no change in the oxidation state of H)

A solution containing one mole per litre of each \(C u\left(N O_{3}\right)_{2}, A g N O_{3}, H g_{2}\left(N O_{3}\right)_{2}\)

and \(M g\left(N O_{3}\right)_{2}\), is being electrolysed by using inert electrodes. The values of

standard electrode potentials in volts (reduction potentials) are \(A g / A g^{+}=+0.80\) \(2 H g / H g_{2}^{2+}=+0.79, C u / C u^{2+}=+0.34, M g / M g^{2+}=-2.37 .\) With increasing voltage, find the sequence of deposition of metals on the cathode.
